intro: Pleroma tedescoi, commonly known as the German pleroma, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant is often found in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, elliptical leaves and has a compact growth habit. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in its natural habitat.
